articles.title: Why saving microbes may be the most important conservation effort ever
articles.description: Researchers have launched the first coordinated plan to protect microbial biodiversity, calling attention to the “invisible 99% of life” that drives essential Earth systems. articles.title: Scientists grow a tiny human “blood factory” that actually works
articles.description: Researchers have recreated a miniature human bone marrow system that mirrors the real structure found inside our bones. The model includes the full mix of cells and signals needed for blood production and even maintains this process for weeks. It could transform how scientists study blood cancers an

articles.title: Light has been hiding a magnetic secret for nearly 200 years
articles.description: New research shows that light’s magnetic field is far more influential than scientists once believed. The team found that this magnetic component significantly affects how light rotates as it passes through certain materials. Their work challenges a 180-year-old understanding of the Faraday Effect a

articles.title: Nearly 47 million Americans live near hidden fossil fuel sites
articles.description: A nationwide analysis has uncovered how sprawling fossil fuel infrastructure sits surprisingly close to millions of American homes. articles.description: The court blocked La Pascaline, a 400-year-old calculating machine, from being exported from France.

articles.title: Letters, Nov. 13, 2025: This ‘may be the beginning of the end of Canada’
articles.description: Let the man work I read the article putting down Carney for apologizing to Trump. articles.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
articles.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

articles.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
articles.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

articles.title: Letters, Nov. 16, 2025: ‘End of a CFL era’
articles.description: Losing our game This Sunday will be the 112th and last Canadian Football League Championship game. The league will roll out an Americanized version of our game next season. articles.title: HILL and THOMPSON: Mayor Farkas should retain ‘blanket rezoning’ for sake of Calgarian families
articles.description: Blanket rezoning was always contentious. Debate over the policy back in spring 2024 sparked the longest public hearing in Calgary’s history, with many Calgarians airing concerns about potential impacts on local infrastructure, parking availability and park space — all important issues.
